title: Panos Kolokotronis
text:
Panos Kolokotronis () was the eldest son of the Greek General <a href="Theodoros%20Kolokotronis">Theodoros Kolokotronis</a> and his mother was Aikaterini Karousou (). He was born on the island of <a href="Zakynthos">Zakynthos</a> in 1800, while his father was serving there as a Major in the British Infantry. He fought along with his father in the <a href="Greek%20War%20of%20Independence">Greek War of Independence</a> and distinguished himself in many battles.
In 1822, he married Eleni, the daughter of <a href="Laskarina%20Bouboulina">Laskarina Bouboulina</a>.
In 1825, during the second <a href="Greek%20civil%20wars%20of%201824%E2%80%931825">civil war</a>, he was murdered in <a href="Tripoli%2C%20Greece">Tripoli</a> by order of the revolutionary government.
